page.title: 08PELHAM HALL,nr.LYDART
page.content: In 1923 a village collection was made to buy a plot of land and build a village hall. The money raised was not enough so the Hon.Arthur Pelham who lived nearby donated Â£100 on condition the building was called 'Pelham Hall'. To celebrate the 50th anniversary of the hall,another village collection was made to improve facilities. An extension was built for toilets and kitchen,and a false ceiling was added to improve heat retention. The hall committee consists of one person representing each of the village organisations. The hall,used by the W.I.,church,chapel,tennis and cricket clubs and the school,has in l985 been used for a ceilidh,barbeque, harvest supper, monthly meetings of the W.I.,whist drives,jumble sales and the school Christmas concert.
